posts.name: Alexander Szura
posts.cooked:
TLDR: don’t use the latest version (2025.1) for LL 3G. Use 2025.0

This post addresses an issue with the new LL 3G firmware (only tested on LL 3G). This issue has been sent to the LL support team, and we wanted to send out a post so that people don’t have to struggle to fix it like we did.

Here are the issues we encountered while using this firmware.

Unable to connect to the LL

Able to connect to the LL GUI but not able to access or change any values or settings, the screen is grayed out waiting to “connect”

Once these issues started there was no way for it to go back. The only fix for this was to reflash the firmware

The robot wouldn’t be able to get any information from the LL and DriverStation would log an error indefinitely

We tried this on both of our LLs and same issues on both.

This issue would seem to happen randomly after powering on your robot and as stated before could only be fixed with a firmware reflash.

Pretty much this is a warning to not spend hours and hours trying to fix radio/rio/power or any other issues when it’s just a simple firmware issue.

GL and have a great season!

Sincerly, Alexander 5409

posts.name: Brandon_Hjelstrom
posts.cooked:
Hello,

We are having trouble reproducing this on our end. How were your cameras connected to your robot? Did you upload anything to the camera?

Thanks

posts.name: Alexander Szura
posts.cooked: Hello! We connected our cameras with direct power to the side of our 3G’s. However, this issue would still happen when connected over USB C. The problem would happen after flashing the firmware (nothing else uploaded) and randomly after the robot reboots. We don’t exactly know the cause. Let me know if you need anything else!

posts.name: ElliotScully
posts.cooked: Hello, we are also having this issue, the only way we had it connected was through ethernet to our radio, nothing else uploaded, newest version of firmware. We haven’t tried anything else, but it randomly fixed itself after a reboot of our robot and some random wire unplugging and replugging.

posts.name: Brandon_Hjelstrom
posts.cooked:
This sounds like a hostname resolution issue. Basically, your browser is trying to use your Limelight’s old address when you type in limelight.local.

Were you using static addressing before flashing your units? It might help if you restart your browser or open a private browser window when something like this happens.

In any case, I think the Hardware Manager (make sure you’re running the latest one) will solve this.

Also, not a bad idea to power cycle the robot/radio in case this is related to dhcp leasing.

posts.name: Alexander Szura
posts.cooked:
We did all of this. Making sure that we were using the static IP, using a different browser, incognito, etc. This would even happen when connecting to the LL via USB C. Sometimes it would randomly fix itself for a bit but then would go back to not working.

The hardware manager could also see the LL but if you wanted to open the web page or restart the LL it would give the same error Driverstation was logging, the econreset error or something like that.

posts.name: Brennan Bibic
posts.cooked:
For what it’s worth we also couldn’t connect to LL4 after flashing either.

Same issue, LL hardware manager could see it, but we could not connect via wireless y or USB.

posts.name: Brandon_Hjelstrom
posts.cooked: This was an indeed issue in the 2025.1 test release, and it has been fixed. The new release is available on the downloads page. Thanks @Aszura , @BrennanB , @ElliotScully and 2928 for the reports.

posts.name: Alexander Szura
posts.cooked:
Awesome thanks!

Just to let you know the dates are wrong for the 2025 images. They say they are released in 2024. Just wanted to let you know!
